In observations, SST is closely linked with ocean mixed layer temperature, T OBS, which is controlled by the balance between the surface heat flux, F OBS, and the combined horizontal and vertical ocean heat transport convergence into the mixed layer, C OBS (Fig.Â 2a)
33 . In any coupled model experiment, initialised from observational estimates, process representation deficiencies in the atmosphere and ocean model components cause errors in this heat budget. This results in evolving biases in the simulated mixed layer temperature, T, surface heat flux, F, and combined horizontal and vertical ocean heat transport convergence into the mixed layer, C.
